results.title: Baboon development: the older infant, four months to one year (Nairobi Park)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Educational Services, Ford Foundation and National Science Foundation
results.brief_description: Part of a series of films on the baboons of Kenya. Shows without commentary or narration, the growth and development of a baby baboon over one year of its life.

results.title: Babies need books
results.creator_credit: New Zealand Trade & Enterprise and New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A mother, grandmother, teacher and children’s bookseller, Dorothy Butler believes that books should play a crucial role in children’s lives right from the first months. The film is an informative and entertaining introduction to 58 favourite children’s books.

results.title: Babe [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Bill Miller, Doug Mitchell, George Miller, Kennedy-Miller and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the story of an unprejudiced heart and how it changed our valley forever. So begins “Babe”, the critically acclaimed, oscar-nominated film where the animals are the true stars. It is the tale of Hoggett’s farm where every creature has a purpose until the orphaned piglet Babe arrives and turns everything upside down. Cared for by Fly the sheepdog, he soon comes to think of himself as a dog. Farmer Hoggett senses something special in Babe and though everyone thinks he is crazy, enters him in the National Sheepdog Championships. This is a truly heartwarming tale about having faith in your abilities and being true to your heart.

results.title: B.W.D.
results.brief_description: Bacillary White Diarrhoea causes an annual loss to the British poultry industry of millions of pounds. The disease can be controlled by careful precautions, including blood-testing of stock and scrupulous attention to hygiene at all stages. This film explains the precautions necessary and gives details of the United Kingdom Ministry of Agriculture’s scheme to combat the disease.

results.title: Avoiding danger
results.creator_credit: Paul White and National Association of Citizens Advice Bureau
results.brief_description: In July 1986 Estate Agent, Suzy Lamplugh, disappeared while on a client appointment. The Suzy Lamplugh Trust was set up to encourage increased awareness among employers and staff of the potential danger from attack in the workplace. The Trust is engaged in comprehensive research in the field of personal vulnerability, and is developing courses to promote greater understanding of the ways to minimise risk. There are practical steps that everyone can take. First, AVOID potential risk by following cautionary procedures. TALK in ways that will placate rather than provoke customers or clients who are aggressive. WALK away from danger. DEFEND yourself if all other methods fail.

results.title: Avalanche (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in the Austrian Tyrol, AVALANCHE is an action packed tale of adventure on a snow holiday. Despite strict regulations imposed by their teacher, two boys set out to climb the mountain. Disaster and gripping drama follow. Rated: G
results.description: Filmed on location in the Austrian Tyrol, AVALANCHE is an action packed tale of adventure on a snow holiday. Despite strict regulations imposed by their teacher, two boys set out to climb the mountain. Disaster and gripping drama follow. Rated: G

results.title: Auto stories
results.creator_credit: Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright, December Films and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Automobiles play a dominant role in 20th century society, making a personal statement about the owner and providing them with a functional vehicle, and for some - an obsession. These 4 half hour segments are united by the fascination between people and their cars. “Affairs of the heart” (Dir: Steve Westh): Dennis, proud owner of Marilyn Monaro - a 1975 Holden Monaro GTS coupe reminisces about past journeys in the vehicle as he prepares to put it on the market. His wife, Rhonda, describes how she copes with her husband’s obsession, meanwhile, we get to spend a day with employees and potential car owners at Melbourne’s Cheapest Car Supermarket. “Wrong way: go back” (Dir: Catherine Marciniak): Follow Vic Roads traffic clearer Neil Dwight as he makes sure the arterials of Melbourne are free from obstruction. The program also follows the decision making process of the Knox City Council as they grapple with the proposed Scoresby Freeway. “Til death do us part” (Dir: Fiona Hergstrom): Speed, alcohol and young males, what is the correlation? A young male involved in a car accident involving alcohol describes how it has affected his life since then. We also witness young drivers at a driver education centre as they go through the ropes of safe driving. “A Little inconvenience” (Dir: Helen Gaynor): Louise scours for someone to insure he Renault after it is involved in a minor accident. The process proves to be a lot lengthier than anticipated.

results.title: Autarky
results.brief_description: Explores digital technology integrated harmoniously with nature. Females are biologically linked to the natural environment and the film explores the patriarchal social system using visual symbolic reference to goddess themes.

results.title: Australian women: their history and achievements
results.brief_description: Australia’s women’s history from 1788 to the present has been a time of enormous change for Aboriginal women, Australian-born and migrant women, working-class and middleclass, in war time and in peace. This video explores the changes in the lives of these women throughout history - changes brought about by economic conditions, legislation, immigration, education, war, the pill and women’s liberation.
